short: Whether itās your reputation or your jewelry, when you protect something you keep it safe from anything that might threaten or harm it.
long: The word protect came into English by way of the Latin verb protegere, a combination of pro- meaning āin front,ā and tegere, meaning āto cover.ā When you protect something, in a way youāre covering it or shielding it from harm. Often the word is used in the sense of protecting something, like a valued item or a person, but you can also protect against something. For example, you might get a flu shot to protect against the flu virus.
